info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 11:14PM CDT until May 31 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHITA...NORTHERN COMANCHE...WEST CENTRAL GRADY... SOUTHERN CADDO AND NORTHEASTERN KIOWA COUNTIES... At 1114 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Gotebo to 9 miles west of Boone to 4 miles east of Medicine Park, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Elgin, Carnegie, Apache, Fletcher, Cyril, Mountain View, Fort Cobb, Cement, Medicine Park, Roosevelt, Gotebo, Cooperton, Meers, Lake Lawtonka, Cloud Chief, Boone, Lake Ellsworth, Fort Sill, Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge and Stecker. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
